posts.post_content:
A massive-cost for an effect that can be found elsewhere for far less. Cool idea, but the initial CC of 10 is insane. Even if you can “cheat” it onto the battlefield, you’re still left with an effect which is a tad underwhelming.
  
   
1/5
posts.html:

1/5

posts.post_content: Granted that to cards now are better and cheaper than this one, back in the day this wasn't such a bad card. When mana artifacts were running around i.e. lotus, mox and [sol ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sol ring) and so on, it wasn't uncommon for 10 mana to be accessible. Even more true in multiplayer games. It's not 5/5 but no one. I'm giving it a 2.0. A decent card but like I said back in the day shatters and disencants were big cards so the lamp really didn't stand much of a chance.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: The speed of the game changed and left this behind. Matches commonly went over 10 rounds and you were most likely top-decking. After 9 rounds, a repeatable semi-Tutor which shuffled your deck was righteous. Add [Energy Tap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Energy Tap ) , or [Animate Artifact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Artifact) and it had a place.
posts.html:

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (4/17/2012 2:26:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: [Aladdin's Lamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aladdin's Lamp) is virtually unplayable without using [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker) or some other trick to get it into play without paying its mana cost. For 10 mana, one would expect to get a powerful artifact. Instead, all you get is a clunky library topdeck manipulator. It served one good purpose, however. Every Timmy player has tried to bring the Lamp to life via [Animate Artifact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Artifact). And heck, back in those days nothing could compare to an animated Aladdin's Lamp in terms of power/toughness.
posts.html:
Aladdin's Lamp is virtually unplayable without using Tinker or some other trick to get it into play without paying its mana cost. For 10 mana, one would expect to get a powerful artifact. Instead, all you get is a clunky library topdeck manipulator. It served one good purpose, however. Every Timmy player has tried to bring the Lamp to life via Animate Artifact. And heck, back in those days nothing could compare to an animated Aladdin's Lamp in terms of power/toughness.
